name: Sourdough Grilled Cheese with Beef Patty, Mozzarella, and Tomato Soup Dip
instructions: 1. Preheat a grill or stovetop pan over medium heat.
2. Cook the beef patties according to your desired level of doneness, typically 4-5 minutes per side for medium. Set aside to rest.
3. Take two slices of sourdough bread and place a slice of mozzarella cheese on each. Top each with a cooked beef patty.
4. Cover the beef patties with another slice of mozzarella cheese and place the remaining slices of sourdough bread on top to make two sandwiches.
5. Grease the grill or pan with a little olive oil or butter.
6. Grill the sandwiches on both sides until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. While the sandwiches are grilling, heat the tomato soup in a small saucepan over low heat until warmed through.
8. Once the sandwiches are done, remove them from the grill or pan and cut them in half or quarters if desired. Serve them alongside the warm tomato soup for dipping.
description: Sourdough Grilled Cheese with Beef Patty, Mozzarella, and Tomato Soup Dip is a delicious and hearty twist on the classic grilled cheese sandwich. The beef patties add a satisfying and flavorful protein, while the melted mozzarella cheese creates a gooey and cheesy texture. The sourdough bread provides a tangy and crunchy base, and when dipped in the warm tomato soup, it becomes the ultimate comfort food combination.
